neither doth resolution mine proceed contempt charity thou art woman pitty thee strumpet hold pity relieve thee despairing hope thy selfe thou pleadest thy brat sith object thy shame thou art sonne withall cause looke child compassion sith neither see mother disdaine envy thou complainest thy misfortune misery without considering starres horoscope thy base birth never pointed thee high estate clownes daughter become gentleman wife thou must adde ambition thy dishonesty one two vice enough powerfull make thee miserable thou doest likewise taxe sonne unkindnesse towards thee without selfe ala ala poore iosselina thy folly thy fortune hath brought thee misery hadst thou grace use abuse thy beauty thou mightst seene thy selfe happy thou art wretched miserable see double losse thou receivest thy single pleasure losse thy chastity mortaigne thy father thee deprived wilt thou doe whither canst thou flye comfort ala misery thy losse double thy griefe thou must well sorrow thy child thy selfe yea iosselina forget grieve thy selfe remember doe thy babe sith thou hast brought world hast wherewith maintaine able proceed farther take kiss raines teares cheekes though cannot streame milk mouth againe recovering speech continues thus ay iosselina thou art author cause thine owne misery therefore thou must blame heaven thanke thy selfe thy affliction great wheresoever thou turnest thy thought eye thou findest nothing griefe nothing sorrow thou think mortaigne lookes thee disdaine mother calintha envie yea thou canst behold world without shame thy poore infant without sorrow thy selfe without repentance nay consider thy selfe thou hast gotten casting rather casting away thy affection mortaigne found thee mayd hath left thee strumpet thou hast child yet husband thou wert happy father thy sonne miserable finde none yea thou wert friend many thou findest one bee thee worse thou hast wherewithall thy selfe ala ala thou hast house goe friend trust meat thy selfe milke thy child therefore poore iosselina quoth happy thou wert buryed unborne would finished speech teares interrupted word sigh cut teares piece time babe fall asleepe griefes great sorrowes infinite shee cannot hath aurora leapt watry bed thetis phoebus discovered golden beames azured firmament heaven diego causeth horse bee made ready tell ansilva father hath sent meet la secco hee fayle bee backe within knowing selfe safe avero father sister shee resolved commit honour life protection yea sooner finished sealed letter effect diego come knockes softly chamber doore berinthia night gowne attire ready shee admits commends care give letter master prayes use possible diligence returne received command hee secretly descends stayres taking leave vilarezo lastly kissing mistresse ansilva hee leapes horse ride first stage leaf gennet take poast leave diego poasting towards elvas come catalina whose malice finding rest revenge remedy shee morne assoone ansilva came chamber demand whether shee prepared performe owne promise hope answereth lady lesse three dayes shall effect give period sister berinthias whereat shee exceedingly glad ignorant diego hath seene berinthia knowes effect ansilva presuming diego sidelity building secresie therefore lesse suspecting journey eluas remaines still gracelesse impious bloudy resolution shee onely presumes assures selfe berinthia neere ebbe dayes setting life therefore like execrable agent devill hath made ready provided selfe second poysoned potion shee way doubt shall send last sleepe female monster bloudy sheeempericke may bee deceived art interim time diego arrives eluas findes master hee hastily delivers berinthias letter antonio kissed breakes seales contrary hope desire reades line berinthia antonio sister catalinas malice extreme mee sith affection thee shee degenerate onely grace nature seekes bereave life bearer thy page praylove sake sith hee god hath preserved mee thine fully particularly acquaint thee manner thereof sith safetie mee father house whose armes protection shall throw selfe onely thine whose true sincere affection constant confident rest assured thou wilt shew thy selfe thy selfe preserving life mine descended bred doubt disgrace disparagement thou hast unjustly offered u justly retort fall thy selfe end thou maist finde sword purposely reserved correct chastise thy tongue thou art romane gentleman meet mee single morrow five morne without port populi next field behinde cardinall borromeos palace give thee choyce two good rapier ponyards gladly accept refusall draw reason thee wrong wherewith thou hast injuriously maliciously traduced u write thee truth desire receive satisfaction whereunto thy malice invite honour obligeth mee brellati valerio performes part well fairely working millan messenger purpose leonardo albemare first letter prevailed thee loane gift fifty ducatons free mee miserable imprisonment make doubt second souldier give thee understand hold farre generous hange starve sith halter onely beginning friend sorrowes likewise end owne misery yea thou speedily furnish accomplish request although cost life longer conceale thou diddest hire pedro selfe two hundred duckatons give signior baretano death thy request wee performed thinke neere secrecie concernes thy life sith suffer death know thou hast short poore time left thee survive mee therefore ambrose church shee beene vespres seeing faire letter fast sealed fooles hand shee enquires whence hee singing hopping still playing letter shee could get answer letter god sent god sent speech hee often redoubled clara weighing word considering whose mouth came heart instantly beganne grow colour rise god soule prompted shee interest letter whereupon snatching foole shee left cry hall losse thereof seeing directed husband go parlor attended adriana sitting downe chaire breaking seales thereof shee begin reade shee drawes towards conclusion thereof find husband albemares caused deare lover friend baretano bee murthered able containe selfe sorrow shee throwes selfe floore weepes sigh mournfully obduratest flintiest heart could chuse relent pitie see sometimes shee lookt heaven againe dejecting eye earth wringing hand crossing armes disconsolate afflicted manner adriana could likewise refraine teares behold deepe profound silence bandying evaporating many volleyes farre fetched sigh ayre shee commanding adriana forth doore shut two extremity passion sorrow shee alone utters mournfull speech selfe shall clara live understand baretano murthered sake unfortunate husband albemare shall lie bed inhumanely hath layen untimely bloudy grave clara clara wilt thou prove ungratefull memory tender affection bore thee lament seeke revenge diastrous cruell end againe teares interrupting word sigh teares entring consultation thought conscience heart soule last cotinues speech manner unfortunate wretched clara speakest thou revenge consider thy selfe yea forget consider baretano thy friend albemare thy husband first loved thee hope marry thee thou art married second therefore thou must love although ingratitude infidelity towards thee make unworthy thy affection yet yee two one flesh therefore consider malice bad advocate revenge worse judge againe remembring foule odious crime murther sight lord discovery thereof infinitely tended glory honour poore foole knowledge misery present assurance confirmation thereof perswaded grant first yet second request receive give maintenance hee still hard hearted neither releive want pitty affliction hatred affection think hath done enough sending love sharp letter answer moron fermia thy husband prove thy liking thou hast reason thanke thy selfe condemne thine owne temerity disobedience choosing affection bee soone forgotten frozen thee punishment god thine first whereof effect doubtlesse prime originall cause thereof vice prodigality hath spent estate little judgement though thou small understanding thinke mine shall redeeme upon whole immytate second folly consequently make selfe guilty consuming thou fleddest without knowledge savona genoua didst marry without consent therefore neither thy griefe misery thy shame repentance shall induce either respect pitty thee daughter lesse releive entertaine thee handmaid young enough worke labour living thy mother selfe therefore know thy youth deserves compassion age satisfie thee best advise counsell give thee thou continually direct thy prayer god thy releife consolation herein thou wilt serve thy selfe please mee glorifie thou regardest command desirest blessing let neither see thee hereafter heare thy vaine foolish letter moron receit father unkinde cruell letter doth one time kill hope dispaire heart griefe doe mad tyranny new cruelty deboshed husband doth contrary nature beyond reason opposite grace many time beates teares hereat useth possible meanes reclaime new vice old vertues continually perswades fairely exhortation thy husband surely thou hast great causeto thinke reason beleeve cruelty towards thee plague punishment sent thee god disobeying thy father marrying without consent blessing thou livedst single thou hadst much felicity joy thou knewest belonged sorrow misery living wife thy husband thou art enforced taste much griefe misery thou knowest belongs joy felicity thou didst surfet choice costliest meat viand thou art ready starve meerly want bread thy apparrell rich rent torne thy beauty made thee sought mariage diver griefes sorrowes defaced withered thou art contemned hated maried thee thy griefes matched thy affliction sorrowes parralleld thou hast husband neither feares serf god neither goe church pray himselfe permit suffer thee doe farre loving thee hee love nothing better hate revile beat thee aye hee drownes himselfe wit wine keep whore thy nose spends estate upon upon bawd pander drunkard offscumme catterpillers world consumes time himselfe making night day day night beastly revel obscene voluptuousnesse upon hath spent much hee hath nothing left either spend maintaine himselfe thee yea thy misery great thy affliction sorrowes sharpe infinite thou hast parent left succour releeve thee lesse friend assist comfort thee poore young woman disconsolate sorrowfull wife thou art blessed happinesse happy blessing thee thou wert either unborne unmarried ala ala thy mother died soone thee thou wert young therefore shee cannot thy father life exceeding rich yet hate thee much assist releeve thee thy kinsfolk refuse lend send thee comfort thy want calamity professed thy friend thy prosperity either see thee thy poverty know thee thy misery againe againe looking pretty babe giving many tender kiss teares interrupting word sigh againe cutting teares peeces shee continueth speech thus thou sweet babe shall say thee sith almost doe nothing thee food give selfe give milke thee yet love thee dearly tenderly although thy unkinde cruell father hate deadly yet starve thou shalt want yea cheerfully worke occasion serve begge selfe death get sustenance necessary preservation thy life live thou sweet babe happy thy poore mother miserable unfortunate die thee hope shall live long say thou hadst mother loved thee thousand time dearer life rich care affection though poore estate mean maintaine thee leave thee nothing behinde nothing left either give leave thee yet give thee blessing leave thee heire religious prayer god divinest favour mercy power downe wrath punishment thee thou mayest live happy thy vertues feare thy father miserable vice true servant instrument disparage heart tongue agree action prove speech complement reall much disdaine condemne therefore cannot give courtesie pray least lend favour may waite father house shall ever bee readie serve much countenance rather smile frownes rejoynes thus imp custome lady gentlewoman loretto use stranger rather much respect little favour especially gent savor honor vanity therfore way wronged mine owne contrarie law owne make civillitie dispence discretion accepting kinde proffer shall accompany mee thither much respect zeale observance thankes kind speech sooner delivered morosini received againe rich goldsmith dijon capitall city burgundie named monseiur de laurier aged threescore yeeres upwards bin franckford marte sold many iewelis bracelts chaines pearle hee received 1700 crownes hee returned homewards great summe money converted couble pistolls hee carried behind cloake bag remaining iewells private leather girdle next body chanced fell sicke way whereof finding himselfe ill weak therefore unwilling unable travell hee got poore countrey taverne upon high way five league towne saline tooke lodging night three marchants company whereof one auxone two troyes champagne unkindly forsooke left alone himselfe sicknesse night increasing gave much paine little rest liking lodging fearing himselfe safe next morning take horse softly ride towards salynes hee arrived two clocke dinner went first inne met extreamest end town signe denis whereof hoast house named adrian wife isabella forty yeeres old short stature weake constitution body cole blacke countenance faire palle putzeole lady mellifanta mine aunt thy presence make mee truly joyfull happie feele know selfe infinitly miserable without although late cause reason god knowes knowe hath pleased thee excercise affection patience thy discontent yet regard thy wife purchase sith thou art husband promise whereof copy thy former letter informe remember thee thou madest god judge soule conscience witness cannot beleeve thou art irreligious thou bearest mee little love much malice make thy selfe guilty foule infidelity mee impiety towards god appeale tender untainted affection thee every way deserved contrary thy hand againe hoping marry thee gave thee heart assurance counfidence thereof thou didest likewise bereave mee honour therefore conterpane contract doe anyway fade dye thy memory yet rest confident originall life still heaven pledge seale thereof doth unhappie wombe earth mistake mee deare sanctifiore write malice true affection thee end thou maiest thereby seriously consider religiously remember thy selfe thee thou selfe unfortunate innocent unborne babe belly u although thy wife god yet humility make selfe thy handmaid world sighes teares throw selfe thy foot lower could conjure begge thee poore beauty thou didest much admire adore memory lost virginity thou wrestedst mee many amarous sighes teares thy deepe oathes vowes promise thou religiously gavest mee remaine still loving mee thine honour bee dearer thee thy life thy conscience soule ought bee far pretious thee life honour world yea thy poore infant sake lastly god sake abandon thy unjust displeasure immerited discontent conceived mee deare sanctifiore come away mee putzeole make mee thy wife sight church people already heaven angells say againe come away mee sweet sanctifiore thy sight delight heart thy presence company ravish soule joy impossible bertranna either love honour thee thousand part dearly thy vrsina doth till death resolve doe freely forget thy former escape discourtesy towards mee doe attribute foolish vanity way thy unkind disposition inclination yea knit browes thou comest mee cheerfully joyfully prepare selfe feast thee smile surfet thee kiss contrariwise thou wilt hearken unto mee letter regard request sorrowes obey follow god thy conscience herein speedily repairing mee make mee thy joyfull wife shall doe say according bound affection duty thee notwithstanding still resolve love thee dearly though thou hate mee deadly pray thee though thou curse mee yea leave thee god religiously beseech divine majestie bee judge betweene u firme affection constancy thee thy cruell ingratitude treacherie mee live thou happie thy constant vrsina knowes without thee shee shall assuredly live sorrowfully die miserablie vrsina messenger sebastiano arives privatly naples find baron sanctifiore chamber fire hee give delivers letter first knowing came stood pretty while musing consulting himselfe whether read burne last hee breakes seales thereof much adoe affords himselfe time patience peruse done although hee way merited receive sweet loving letter vrsina yet blushing shame looking pale envie malice thereat hee darting forth disdainfull frowne tearing letter peeces throwes fire turning himselfe hastily towards sebastiano stood neere saw hee done hee great choler spake thus tell proud foolish gigglet vrsina disdaine much shee writes shee love mee ever hereafter heart begin impaire health strength consequently pervert alter constitution body whereas poore unborne babe lived one full moneth within find many suddaine throwes unacustomed convulsion shee speedily constrained betake selfe bed calling upon aunt mellefanta withall possible hast sending way midwife shee many sharpe torment bitter cry groanes great perrill eminent danger life delivered verie pretty little sonne god sends world dead borne although shee want curious care comfort attendance aunt sicknes extremity yet shee weeps bitterlie pittifully abortive birth untimely death poore innocent babe infant aunt see last affliction sorrow neece doth infinitly encrease revive former shee also conceives wonderfull feare heart scruple conscience immoderate griefe sorrow hath kild child therefore discreet matrone wise lady remove article neeces beliefe memory tell plainly freely shee extremly deceived point doubt feare sorrow base ingratitude treachery false lover sanctifiore selfe kild child within tart yet true speech vrsina neither soone easily forget aunt mellefanta hath spoken shall tearme affection vrsina towards sanctifiore needlesse vanity superfluous ceremony selfe shee desire kisse breathlesse innocent babe sake shee doth giving thousand kiss washing face teares lamenting grieving shee could breath life sighes shee recommends againe aunt shee night secret decent buriall while thus vrsina remaines weake sicke bed yet still heart affection lookes constantly sanctifiore needle compasse doth north notwithstanding base ingratitude cruelty time time shewed towards thousand grieses pitties ever hee set eye shee many shame first seduce betray therefore would way commend continuing love rather would infinitly blame folly condemne want wit judgment ever either hope hearken yet silly young lady bewitched middest sicknes sorrowes contrary sence reason breakes forth sparckle flash polley selfe affection towards neither dare trust sebastiano coachman great secret much import honour disgrace message sanctifiore though vaine shee expects hope content exempting chamber call herbeds side swearing secrecy want strength write chargeth presently ride poast naples againe find baron sanctifiore tell selfe extreme sicke like live shee delivered sonne dead borne therefore begs god sake hee speedily come good content infinitly desireth discharge mind conscience goe heaven sebastiano discharge dutie lady command seems rather fly poast naples ariving sanctifiores house finding within hee sends name one men also hee earnestly desire speake word lordship sanctifiore knowing therefore imagining hee came bid man carry sebastiano backe answer hee neither speake see sebastiano perplexed short sharp reply message great importance also hee exceedingly respecteth honoureth young lady mistris hee resolve returne foole end foot staires hee enquireth another servant hee thinkes lord goe forth tell hee take coach within halfe houre whereof sebastiano exceeding glad hee thinkes best stay street much vigilancy impatiency hee attends comming last hee see issue forth gate presently sebastiano placeth selfe betwixt coach hat hand resolutly orderly delivereth mistris message full sanctifiore understanding hee first smile thereat presently againe entering choler hee round sehastiano answer eare tell strumpet thy mistris vrsina mee wish shee buryed bastard devill without speaking one word mighty fume anger disdaine hee throwes himselfe way sebastiano coach speedily hurry away sweet heart bertranna hee seldome never absent hee revealed past passage sicknesse riseth bed fire call chamber maid night gowne haveing drawne thee bid •… while absent selfe send coachman 〈◊〉 although sorrowfull lookes countenance shee •… already tacitly reade large
